body_html: I don't think it's hackish, I'd say it's quite standard. I doubt you'll deplete an iterator of such length on any common hardware, for years to come. I also don't think it's going to break if the DataLoader internals change - it conforms to the dataset API, so it should work with all future versions too (unless we change that interface, but I doubt it).

body: I don't think it's hackish, I'd say it's quite standard. I doubt you'll deplete an iterator of such length on any common hardware, for years to come. I also don't think it's going to break if the `DataLoader` internals change - it conforms to the dataset API, so it should work with all future versions too (unless we change that interface, but I doubt it).
